headline.main: NAZI TROOP SHIFT TO BULGARIA SEEN; Ankara Also Hears That Gen. List Has Been in Both Athens and Sofia BUT A DRIVE IS DOUBTED Reich Soldiers Said to Move South May Be Going to Rest Billets, Expert Believes

lead_paragraph: ANKARA, Turkey, July 31--Reports circulating in foreign military circles here tonight said that an undesignated number of German troops was being moved from the Russian front to Bulgaria. These reports lacked official confirmation.
abstract: German troop shift from USSR to Bulgaria raises speculation on possible threat to Turkey

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICAN, BALKAN AND NEAR EAST AREAS

byline.original: By RAY BROCKSpecial Broadcast to THE NEW YORK TIMES
